content.description: Use the good finger rail to get established on the even better left foot and grab the top. One move wonder, but it's kind of a fun move...
content.location: Right side of the main wall at Breakfast at Tiffany's.

content.description:
Start on the good finger rail and move up right through a couple of slopers/pinches.

Felt a little awkward and there is an unfortunately placed boulder at the bottom, both of which decrease the overall quality.
content.location: Far right side of the main wall at Breakfast at Tiffany's

content.description:
Follow the obvious large gash above the main wall of the Breakfast at Tiffany's area. Crux is the first move...getting established up in the crack. 5.7 or 5.8 moves.

A pretty fun, unique adventure.
content.location: Above and to the right of the main wall at Breakfast at Tiffany's.

content.description: Start on the prow as for Charade, but move immediately right then up on incredible jugs. Super fun!
content.location: On the main wall at Breakfast at Tiffany's, in the left alcove.

content.description: Start with your right hand on the sidepull and your left on the dish just under the obvious good hold on the arete.
content.location: To the right just off the main path on the way to the lizards mouth. Slightly past the main Breakfast at Tiffany's area.

content.description: Sit start under the roof of the boulder, pull up and establish yourself using any number of knee-bars, and grab the jugs at the lip. Throw up left to a thin crimp rail (crux), and pull out over the lip to easier terrain above.
content.location: A fairly obvious line when in the B.a.T. area. Starts under a cave-like boulder in the left alcove.

content.description:
I traversed the ever-thinning horizontal crack left to right then did a big move to the top near the far right end of the crack.

Fun looking harder low start option off of two pockets on the left side. Probably some sort of more direct start as well.
content.location: In the left side alcove at Breakfast at Tiffany's. On the boulder directly opposite the Roman Holiday roof.

content.description: Step up onto good foot rail using right hand edge, then straight up the prow. Great holds, fun balancy crux, nice and tall problem.
content.location: On the main wall at Breakfast at Tiffany's, in the left alcove.
